main event: A bright, white light with a diameter of 25+ feet was observed at tree-top level in Hampton Corners, Virginia on 03/22/54 at 12:15 by a civilian. The object was observed moving up and down very fast for 55 seconds before going out of sight. The conclusion was insufficient data.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 55 seconds, allowing for a detailed account of the object's behavior.
The object was sighted twice, indicating a consistent and repeatable observation.
The report lists the weather and wind conditions, providing environmental context for the sighting.
The description mentions involvement of a police officer from the Hampton Police Department in Hampton, VA, lending credibility to the observation.
The document refers to several military and air force bases, potentially indicating an interest in the sighting from military authorities.
sighted object: a bright, white light with a diameter of 25+ feet at tree-top level
witnesses: civilian, possible involvement of a police officer from the Hampton Police Department
